name: Aasimar Redeemer
items: crossbow (10 bolts)
half plate
steel shield (Hardness 5, 20 HP, BT 10)
longsword

mid.trigger: The angelkin is targeted by a spell that allows a saving throw.
entries: The scion gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the saving throw.
mid.name: Divine Grace

mid.trigger: An enemy damages one of the angelkin's allies.
entries: Both the enemy and ally must be within 15 feet of the angelkin. The angelkin causes its foe to hesitate under the weight of its sins as visions of possible redemption play out in its mind's eye. The foe chooses one of two options:

items: The ally is completely unharmed by the triggering damage.
The ally gains resistance 7 to all damage against the triggering damage. After the damaging effect resolves, the enemy becomes {@condition enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

mid.name: Glimpse of Redemption

entries: harmed by acid ({@dice 9d10}, {@dice 2d10} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by fire (area {@dice 2d10} HP); {@condition slowed} by electricity.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: When the adamantine golem is at 0 HP, it isn't destroyed. Instead, it enters repair mode, during which it is {@condition slowed 1}, can't take reactions, and can take only the Self-{@action Repair} action. Once it has more than 30 HP, it can use any type of action and can use reactions, though it remains {@condition slowed 1} and can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. If a critical hit with an adamantine vorpal weapon reduces the golem to 0 HP, or if such a weapon hits it while it's already at 0 HP, then the golem is destroyed.
mid.name: Repair Mode

entries: The golem can be targeted by disjunction and dispel magic. If targeted by such a spell of 9th level or higher, the golem has its resistance to physical damage lowered to 15 and is {@condition slowed 1} (or {@condition slowed 2} if in repair mode) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. During this time, if the golem is reduced to 0 HP while already in repair mode, it is destroyed.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling

entries: On a critical hit, the adamantine golem's fist {@action Strike} breaks the target's armor, if any, in addition to dealing damage to the target. If the target has a shield raised, the golem breaks the shield instead.
bot.name: Destructive Strike

entries: The adamantine golem {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can try to bar the way by attempting a {@dc 45} Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature takes no damage and its armor takes no damage.
entries.Success: The golem halts its movement and cannot enter the creature's square.
entries.Failure: The resisting creature is damaged and its armor takes damage as if hit by the adamantine golem's fist.

bot.name: Inexorable March

entries: The golem repairs itself, regaining 30 Hit Points.
bot.name: Self-Repair

entries: The golem vents a 30-foot cone of superheated steam from its internal forge. This deals {@damage 15d6} fire damage to all creatures in the cone ({@dc 40} basic Reflex). The golem can't use Vent again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Vent

abilities: repair mode

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 28}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The dragon {@action Strike||Strikes} with its tail at the triggering creature at a –2 penalty. If it hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.
mid.name: Tail Lash
mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the dragon's tail takes an action to {@action Strike} or attempt a skill check

entries: The dragon breathes a spray of acid that deals {@damage 12d6} acid damage in an 80-foot line ({@dc 30} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon permanently befouls 10 cubic feet of liquid within 90 feet. The liquid becomes undrinkable and unable to support water-breathing life. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a {@dc 28} Will save to protect liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.
bot.name: Corrupt Water

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horns {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The dragon can mimic any sound it has heard. It must succeed at a {@skill Deception} check with a +4 circumstance bonus to do so.
top.name: Sound Imitation

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 32}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
mid.name: Wing Deflection
mid.trigger: The dragon is targeted with an attack.

entries: The dragon breathes lightning that deals {@damage 9d12} electricity damage in a 100-foot line ({@dc 33} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: When casting create water, the dragon can attempt to destroy liquid instead of creating it, turning an equal amount of liquid into sand. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a {@dc 32} Will save to protect all liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.
bot.name: Desert Thirst

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horns {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
speak with animals

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 28}

entries: The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
mid.name: Wing Deflection
mid.trigger: The dragon is targeted with an attack.

entries: The brass dragon breathes fire in an 80-foot line that deals {@damage 12d6} fire damage ({@dc 32} basic Reflex save). The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon calls upon the desert wind. This has the same effect as gust of wind ({@dc 30} Fortitude) but in a 60-foot cone. A creature that fails its save is also {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn (or for 1 minute on a critical failure).
bot.name: Desert Wind

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one jaws {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
speak with animals

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 1d12} electricity damage. The bronze dragon can turn this aura on or off using a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait, and it can choose to not affect allies with the aura.
mid.name: Electricity Aura

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 31}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The bronze dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items: {@bold Lightning} (arcane, electricity, evocation); The dragon breathes lightning in a 80-foot line that deals {@damage 8d12} electricity damage ({@dc 33} basic Reflex save).

{@bold Repulsion Gas} (abjuration, arcane, incapacitation, mental); The dragon breathes a 80-foot line of repulsive gas. Each creature in the area must succeed at a {@dc 33} Will save or become {@condition fleeing} from the dragon for 1 round (or 2 rounds on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: For up to 60 minutes per day, the dragon, along with allied creatures and vessels within 50 feet, can move at double their normal Speed in water.
bot.name: Water Mastery

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
climb stone 40 feet

entries: The dragon makes a tail {@action Strike} at the creature with a –2 penalty. If it hits, the dragon disrupts the triggering action.
mid.name: Twisting Tail
mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the copper dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

items: {@bold Acid} (acid, arcane, evocation); The dragon breathes acid in a 80-foot line that deals {@damage 13d6} acid damage ({@dc 32} basic Fortitude save).

{@bold Slowing Gas} (arcane, transmutation); The dragon breathes a 80-foot line of slowing gas. Each creature in the area must succeed at a {@dc 32} Fortitude save or be {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round (or {@condition slowed 2} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon's climb speed functions only when climbing stone surfaces.
bot.name: Climb Stone

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: The gold dragon fails a saving throw.
entries: The dragon improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Golden Luck

entries: The gold dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items.name: Flame
entries: The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a 40-foot cone that deals {@damage 15d6} fire damage ({@dc 37} basic Reflex save).

items.name: Weakening Gas
entries: The dragon breathes a blast of weakening gas. Each creature within a 40-foot cone must succeed at a {@dc 37} Fortitude save or become {@condition enfeebled 2} for 1 minute (or {@condition enfeebled 3} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The gold dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horns {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the gold dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

trackless step
woodland stride

entries: The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals {@damage 13d6} poison damage in a 50-foot cone ({@dc 31} basic Fortitude save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horn {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The green dragon always gains the benefits of {@action Cover Tracks} in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
bot.name: Trackless Step

entries: The green dragon ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from non-magical foliage.
bot.name: Woodland Stride

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: Smoke doesn't impair a red dragon's vision; it ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: 5 feet, {@damage 3d6} fire damage ({@dc 30} basic Reflex)
mid.name: Dragon Heat

top.name: Fog Vision

entries: The silver dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

{@bold Paralyzing Gas} (arcane, enchantment, incapacitation); The dragon breathes a blast of paralyzing gas. Each creature within a 40-foot cone must succeed at a {@dc 35} Fortitude save or be {@condition slowed 2} for 1 round (or {@condition paralyzed} for 2 round on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The silver dragon can tread on clouds or fog as though on solid ground.

ice climb 30 feet

entries: Snow doesn't impair a white dragon's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
top.name: Snow Vision

entries: 5 feet, {@damage 2d6} cold damage ({@dc 27} basic Reflex)
mid.name: Dragon Chill

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 27}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The dragon's blood sprays on the creature, dealing {@damage 2d6} cold damage. A creature that takes cold damage in this way is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
mid.name: Freezing Blood
mid.trigger: An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the dragon.

entries: The dragon breathes a cloud of frost that deals {@damage 11d6} cold damage in a 40-foot cone ({@dc 29} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The dragon slams into the ground. It can do this if it's on the ground or Flying within 10 feet of the ground. Each creature on the ground within 10 feet must succeed at a {@dc 29} Reflex save or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage. The dragon can then {@action Step}.
bot.name: Ground Slam

entries: A white dragon can climb on ice as though it had the listed climb Speed. It ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.
bot.name: Ice Climb

entries: The dragon reshapes a cube of ice or snow it touches, up to 10 feet across. Any creature standing atop the ice must succeed at a {@dc 15} Reflex save or {@skill Acrobatics} check. On a failure, the creature falls {@condition prone} atop the ice; on a critical failure, it falls off the ice entirely and is also {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Shape Ice

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The air mephit breathes sand and grit in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} slashing damage to each creature within the area ({@dc 17} basic Reflex save). The air mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

abilities: fast healing 2 (in open air)

entries: An alchemical golem's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined {@trait alchemical} effect, roll {@dice 1d6} and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no {@trait alchemical} effect): 1 acid damage; 2 cold damage; 3 electricity damage; 4 fire damage; 5 poison damage; 6 sickness: {@dc 26} Fortitude save or {@condition sickened 1} ({@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure)
mid.name: Alchemical Chambers

entries: When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a {@spell shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a 5-foot emanation. Roll on the alchemical chambers list (see above) to determine which one shatters—on a roll of 1–5, creatures in the area take {@dice 10d6} damage of the appropriate type ({@dc 28} basic Reflex). On a roll of 6, creatures must instead save against the sickness effect.
mid.name: Alchemical Rupture

entries: harmed by sonic ({@dice 5d8}, {@dice 2d6} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by acid (area {@dice 2d4} HP); {@condition slowed} by cold.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: Casting a {@spell shatter} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture (see above).
mid.name: Vulnerable to Shatter

entries: When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe {@action Strike}, roll {@dice 1d6} on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack. The syringe deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage of the appropriate type (or exposes the target to the sickness effect, as appropriate).
bot.name: Alchemical Injection

entries: The golem fills an empty vial from one of its alchemical chambers to create a bomb and then makes a bomb {@action Strike}. Determine the type of bomb created by rolling {@dice 1d6} on the alchemical chambers list above. On a roll of 1–4, it creates the corresponding greater alchemical bomb: an acid flask from chamber 1, a frost vial from chamber 2, bottled lightning from chamber 3, or alchemist's fire from chamber 4. On a roll of 5, it creates a poisonous bomb that deals {@damage 3d10} poison damage and 3 poison {@trait splash} damage with no other effects. On a roll of 6, it creates a sickness bomb, which exposes the target and all creatures in the splash radius to the sickness effect; creatures hit by only the splash receive a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude saves.
bot.name: Generate Bomb

entries: 5 feet. While underwater, an aboleth exudes a cloud of transparent slime. An air-breathing creature adjacent to an aboleth must succeed at a {@dc 25} Fortitude save each round or lose the ability to breathe air but gain the ability to breathe water for 3 hours.
top.name: Mucus Cloud

bot.note: A {@spell remove disease} spell can counteract this curse, but immunity to disease offers no protection against it.

stages.entry: the victim's skin softens, inflicting {@condition drained 1}

the victim's skin transforms into a clear, slimy membrane, inflicting {@condition drained 2} until the curse ends; every hour this membrane remains dry, the creature's drained condition increases by 1

bot.name: Slime

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+14} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} acid and {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid}

entries: Whenever the dragon uses Breath Weapon while the illusory image from its innate {@spell project image} spell persists, it can cause the Breath Weapon to originate from itself or the image.
bot.name: Mirage

bot.requirements: A storm cloud created by Breath Weapon is within 500 feet, and the dragon can see the cloud.
entries: The dragon calls down a lightning bolt from a storm cloud created by its Breath Weapon. This creates a vertical line of lightning to the ground that deals {@damage 6d12} electricity damage to all enemies in its path ({@dc 40} basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Storm Breath

mid.name: Vortex

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: A creature in the dragon's vortex uses a {@action Swim} action.
entries: The dragon creates a current of water, forcing the triggering creature to attempt a {@dc 40} {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Swim}. If the creature fails, it's pulled 30 feet toward the dragon and the triggering action is lost. If it succeeds, it can {@action Swim} normally (using the result of that roll if it doesn't have a {@action Swim} speed).
mid.name: Vortex Pull

entries: The copper dragon tells a fantastic joke. Each creature in a 100-foot emanation must succeed at a {@dc 39} Will save or suffer the effects of a 9th-level {@spell hideous laughter} spell for 1 minute.
bot.name: Mass Laughter

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 39}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The dragon gains 2 reactions at the start of its turn each round.
mid.name: Extra Reaction

entries: The dragon improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Golden Luck
mid.trigger: The gold dragon fails a saving throw.

entries: The gold dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items.name: Flame
entries: The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a 50-foot cone that deals {@damage 20d6} fire damage ({@dc 44} basic Reflex save).

items.name: Weakening Gas
entries: The dragon breathes a blast of weakening gas. Each creature within a 50-foot cone must succeed at a {@dc 44} Fortitude save or become {@condition enfeebled 3} for 1 minute (or {@condition enfeebled 4} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The gold dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horns {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the gold dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
trackless step
woodland stride

entries: The dragon can {@action Hide} in natural environments even if it doesn't have cover.
top.name: Camouflage

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 37}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: 20 feet. After the dragon uses its Breath Weapon, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from its body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage ({@dc 37} basic Fortitude save). Any creature in the miasma is {@condition concealed} and treats other creatures as {@condition concealed}. The dragon can see through this concealment.
mid.name: Miasma

entries: The dragon makes a tail {@action Strike} at the creature with a –2 penalty. If it hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.
mid.name: Twisting Tail
mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

entries: The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals {@damage 18d6} poison damage in a 60-foot cone ({@dc 37} basic Fortitude save). The Breath Weapon also creates a miasma. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horn {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The green dragon always gains the benefits of {@action Cover Tracks} in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
bot.name: Trackless Step

entries: The green dragon ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from non-magical foliage.
bot.name: Woodland Stride

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: Smoke doesn't impair a red dragon's vision; it ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 4d6} fire damage ({@dc 39} basic Reflex)
mid.name: Dragon Heat

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 40}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: A creature within 100 feet casts a fire spell, or a fire spell otherwise comes into effect from a source within 100 feet.
entries: The dragon makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, or other effects of the spell, as though it were the caster.
mid.name: Redirect Fire

entries: The dragon breathes a blast of flame that deals {@damage 20d6} fire damage in a 60-foot cone ({@dc 42} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one wing {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The red dragon attempts to take control of a magical fire or a fire spell within 100 feet. If it succeeds at a counteract check (counteract level 10, counteract modifier +32), the original caster loses control of the spell or magic fire, control is transferred to the dragon, and the dragon counts as having Sustained the Spell with this action (if applicable). The dragon can choose to end the spell instead of taking control, if it chooses.
bot.name: Manipulate Flames

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
cloud walk

entries: The silver dragon ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from fog and clouds.
top.name: Fog Vision

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 40}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: 15 feet, {@damage 3d6} cold damage. The silver dragon can turn this aura on or off as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait, and can choose not to affect allies within the aura.
mid.name: Cold Aura

entries: The spell is reflected back upon the caster, with the effect of spell turning.
mid.trigger: The silver dragon critically succeeds at a saving throw against a spell, or a caster trying to target the dragon critically fails their attack roll.
mid.name: Reflect Spell

entries: The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
mid.name: Wing Deflection
mid.trigger: The silver dragon is targeted with an attack.

entries: The silver dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items: {@bold Frost} (arcane, cold, evocation); The dragon breathes a cloud of frost in a 50-foot cone that deals {@damage 20d6} cold damage ({@dc 42} basic Reflex save).

{@bold Paralyzing Gas} (arcane, enchantment, incapacitation); The dragon breathes a blast of paralyzing gas. Each creature within a 50-foot cone must succeed at a {@dc 42} Fortitude save or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round (or 3 rounds on a critical failure).

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The silver dragon can tread on clouds or fog as though on solid ground.
bot.name: Cloud Walk

entries: The silver dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the silver dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
ice climb 40 feet

entries: Snow doesn't impair a white dragon's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
top.name: Snow Vision

entries: 50 feet. After the dragon uses its Breath Weapon, a fierce blizzard of blinding snow surrounds its body for 1 round. Everything in the aura is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for other creatures that are on the ground, climbing, or flying. The blowing snow also makes all creatures in the area {@condition concealed}. While the blizzard rages, the dragon's dragon chill extends to the full area of the blizzard.
mid.name: Blizzard

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 3d6} cold damage ({@dc 34} basic Reflex)
mid.name: Dragon Chill

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 34}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The dragon's blood sprays on the creature, dealing {@damage 3d6} cold damage. A creature that takes cold damage in this way is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
mid.name: Freezing Blood
mid.trigger: An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the dragon.

entries: The dragon breathes a cloud of frost that deals {@damage 16d6} cold damage in a 50-foot cone ({@dc 36} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The dragon slams into the ground. It can do this if it's on the ground or Flying within 10 feet of the ground. Each creature on the ground within 10 feet must succeed at a {@dc 37} Reflex save or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage. The dragon can then {@action Step}.
bot.name: Ground Slam

entries: A white dragon can climb on ice as though it had the listed climb Speed. It ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.
bot.name: Ice Climb

entries: The dragon reshapes a cube of ice or snow it touches, up to 10 feet across. Any creature standing atop the ice must succeed at a {@dc 15} Reflex save or {@skill Acrobatics} check. On a failure, the creature falls {@condition prone} atop the ice; on a critical failure, it falls off the ice entirely and is also {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Shape Ice

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: Like normal objects, an animated armor has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated armor is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13.
mid.name: Construct Armor

entries: Like normal objects, an animated broom has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.
mid.name: Construct Armor

entries: A creature hit by an animated broom's bristles must succeed at a {@dc 15} Fortitude save or spend its next action coughing. Even if hit by multiple dust attacks, the creature has to spend only 1 action coughing to clear the dust out. A creature that doesn't breathe is immune to this effect.
bot.name: Dust

entries: Like normal objects, an animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated broom is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 15.
mid.name: Construct Armor

entries: The ankhrav makes a mandibles {@action Strike}; if the {@action Strike} hits, the target's armor takes the damage and the acid damage bypasses the armor's Hardness.
bot.name: Armor-Rending Bite

entries: The ankhrav spews acid in a 30-foot cone, dealing {@damage 3d6} acid damage and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage} ({@dc 20} basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Spray Acid

entries: A creature struck by the ankylosaurus's tail must attempt a {@dc 24} Fortitude save. On a failure, it's {@condition slowed 1} until the end of its next turn; on a critical failure, it's {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
bot.name: Punishing Tail

entries: Medium or smaller, foot, {@dc 24}
bot.name: Trample

entries: An annis hag adds earthbind, passwall, and spellwrack to her coven's spells.
top.name: Coven

entries: Once per day, an annis hag can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, the annis hag gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal {@action Grapple}, the annis hag doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes ({@dc 24}), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.
bot.name: Bonds of Iron

entries: The hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her {@action Strike||Strikes} but might change the damage type her {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

name: Arbiter
items: {@item shortsword}

entries: An arbiter can always sense the direction of the nearest non-arbiter inevitable on the plane, but it cannot sense the range of the inevitable.
Items shortsword.
top.name: Locate Inevitable

entries: The arbiter releases an electrical burst from its body that deals {@damage 3d6} electricity damage ({@dc 17} basic Reflex save). Following such a burst, the arbiter becomes {@condition stunned} for 24 hours.
bot.name: Electrical Burst

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
speak with plants

entries: The arboreal regent takes 5 additional damage from axes.
mid.name: Axe Vulnerability

entries: The arboreal regent causes a tree within 180 feet to uproot itself and fight as a minion using the statistics for an awakened tree. The arboreal regent can control up to two awakened trees at a time, and it can issue commands to both trees as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} and {@trait auditory} traits.
bot.name: Awaken Tree

entries: When an arboreal regent damages an item or structure, it deals an additional {@dice 2d10} damage to that item or structure.
bot.name: Sunder Objects

name: Arboreal Warden
items: large bark shield (Hardness 3, Hit Points 20, BT 10)
stone longsword

entries: An arboreal warden takes 5 additional damage from axes.
mid.name: Axe Vulnerability

entries: The arboreal warden {@action Stride||Strides} and then makes a shield bash {@action Strike}. If the attack hits, the target is pushed 10 feet.
bot.name: Shield Push

abilities: telepathy 100 feet

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+9} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil, essence drain, and Grab

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+9} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and Essence Drain

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+9} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} evil and Essence Drain

entries: 30 feet. An astradaemon draws power from the souls of the recently slain. If a Small or larger living creature dies within its aura, the astradaemon gains 5 temporary Hit Points and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 round, unless the creature was slain by an astradaemon's.
mid.name: Soul Siphon

entries: Soul ability. Incorporeal undead and living spirits traveling outside the body take {@damage 1d8} force damage each round within the daemon's aura from the spiritual pressure as the astradaemon pulls in fragments of their soul.
mid.name: Devour

entries: An astradaemon bends light, appearing shifted from its true position, though still in the same space. Creatures targeting the astradaemon must attempt a DC {@flatDC 11} flat check, as if the astradaemon were {@condition hidden}, even though it remains {@condition observed}. s such as the Blind-Fight feat and halfling's keen eyes that apply on the flat check against {@condition hidden} creatures also apply against a displaced astradaemon.
mid.name: Displacement

bot.requirements: The astradaemon hasn't used an action with the {@trait attack} trait yet this turn.
entries: The astradaemon draws out and consumes the soul of a living creature it has {@condition grabbed}. The creature must succeed at a {@dc 35} Fortitude save or instantly die. If it dies, the astradaemon gains 10 temporary Hit Points and a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute, or for 1 day if the victim was 15th level or higher. A victim slain in this way can be returned to life normally. A creature that survives is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
bot.name: Devour Soul

entries: When an astradaemon hits with its claw, jaws, or tail, it drains the target's spiritual and vital essences. The target takes {@damage 2d10} negative energy damage and the astradaemon regains an equal number of Hit Points. The target must succeed at a {@dc 37} Fortitude save or become {@condition doomed 1} and {@condition drained 1}. If the target was already {@condition drained} or {@condition doomed}, it instead increases both conditions' value by 1, to a maximum of 4.
bot.name: Essence Drain

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

name: Astral Deva

abilities: tongues

items: +2 striking warhammer

entries: 20 feet. Creatures in the astral deva's aura are protected from ambient environmental damage from any plane, including severe and extreme heat and cold as well as more exotic dangers. The astral deva is never {@condition flat-footed} to creatures within its aura.
mid.name: Traveler's Aura

entries: An astral deva with a message to deliver is continually protected by the effect of sanctuary ({@dc 32}). If the deva breaks the sanctuary, the effect returns if the deva ceases hostility for 10 minutes.
mid.name: Messenger's Amnesty

entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a holy property rune while an astral deva wields it.
bot.name: Divine Armament

bot.requirements: The astral deva hit a foe earlier this turn with a weapon {@action Strike}.
entries: The astral deva makes a weapon {@action Strike} against the foe. On a success, the foe must succeed at a {@dc 34} Fortitude save or become {@condition stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the foe is {@condition stunned 2} instead.
bot.name: Stunning Strike

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: An awakened tree takes 5 additional damage from axes.
mid.name: Axe Vulnerability

name: Axiomite
items: sterling artisan's tools
+1 striking warhammer

entries: The axiomite shifts between its humanoid form and that of a cloud of crystalline dust in which strange symbols and equations flash. In this form it gains a fly Speed of 40 feet and can fit through even tiny apertures, similarly to gaseous form. It can cast spells, but it can't make melee or ranged attacks in this state. It can return to its humanoid form by using this action while in crystalline dust form.
bot.name: Crystalline Dust Form

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The purple worm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
mid.name: Inexorable

entries: The purple worm negates the triggering condition or effect. s from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.
mid.name: Shake It Off
mid.trigger: The purple worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as baleful polymorph).

entries: The azure worm Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 30 feet, making a {@action Strike} against a creature at the apex of the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 45 feet of the water's surface). After the {@action Strike}, the worm splashes back down. It can use {@ability Improved Grab} on this {@action Strike} and follow it up with Fast Swallow.
bot.name: Breach

entries: The worm uses Swallow Whole.
bot.name: Fast Swallow

entries: Huge, {@damage 3d8+10} bludgeoning, Rupture 27.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The worm makes a {@action Strike} once against each creature in its reach. It can {@action Strike} up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
bot.name: Thrash

name: Balisse

abilities: tongues

items: +1 striking scimitar

entries: 20 feet. Creatures in the balisse's aura are subject to zone of truth ({@dc 23}). Additionally, if these creatures choose to honestly express their own conflicted feelings, the aura makes it easier for them to put words to those feelings.
mid.name: Confessor's Aura

entries: The balisse marks an evil creature within its confessor's aura as irredeemable. It can only do so after a failed attempt to convince the creature to repent. The touched creature takes a –1 status penalty to AC and saves, reduces its resistances by 2, and gains weakness 2 to good damage. The duration depends on the target's {@dc 26} Will save.
bot.name: Brand of the Impenitent

entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a flaming property rune while a balisse wields it.
bot.name: Flaming Armament

entries: While {@condition invisible}, a balisse can spiritually attach itself to a non-evil mortal. When it does so, it merges with the mortal's body and is unable to use any of its spells and abilities other than to interact with the mortal. It must use Guiding Angel again to leave the mortal. While merged with the mortal, the balisse can take a form of its choice that only the mortal can see, such as a small angel on the mortal's shoulder. Alternatively, it can communicate with the mortal using a bodiless voice only the mortal can hear.
bot.name: Guiding Angel

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

mid.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by the ball python attempts to {@action Escape}.
entries: The DC of the {@action Escape} check is increased by 2.
mid.name: Tighten Coils

entries: {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning, {@dc 17}
bot.name: Constrict

bot.requirements: A Medium or smaller creature is {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in the ball python's jaws.
entries: The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.
bot.name: Wrap in Coils

name: Balor

abilities: telepathy 100 feet

items: longsword

attacks.name: cold iron silver flame whip
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d6+17} fire plus {@damage 1d6} evil, {@ability Improved Grab}, and whip reposition

entries: 20 feet. A foe that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 3d6+10} fire damage, or {@damage 6d6+20} fire damage if the balor has {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} it. A creature that hits a balor with an unarmed {@action Strike} takes {@damage 3d6+10} fire damage, and weapons that hit a balor take {@damage 3d6+10} fire damage.
mid.name: Aura of Flame

entries: The balor can use {@action Attack of Opportunity} when a creature within their reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. They can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and they disrupt actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: When a balor dies, their body explodes in a 100-foot aura of intense demonic flame. All creatures and objects in range take {@damage 16d10} fire damage ({@dc 45} basic Reflex save). Because the flame is infused with Abyssal energy, creatures in the area apply only half their usual fire resistance. Creatures with immunity to fire use an outcome one degree of success better than what they rolled, instead of gaining the usual benefit of immunity. The bodies of creatures reduced to 0 Hit Points by a balor's death throes are completely incinerated into fine ash.
mid.name: Death Throes

entries: A balor can cast their 5th-level innate dimension door with only a single action.
bot.name: Dimensional Dervish

bot.trigger: The balor hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a weapon {@action Strike}.
entries: The balor casts an innate dispel magic on the target of the triggering {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Dispelling Strike

entries: Any weapon a balor wields becomes a +3 major striking vorpal weapon made of cold iron and silver while the demon holds it. A weapon that isn't eligible for the vorpal rune doesn't gain its effects. The balor can change its evil damage to chaotic whenever it attacks. The demon can conjure a whip made of flames with an {@action Interact} action. This whip gains the same benefits as other weapons the balor wields.
bot.name: Infuse Weapons

bot.trigger: The balor kills a living creature that is at least 15th level.
entries: The balor drinks the triggering creature's life force and regains {@dice 10d8+80} Hit Points.
bot.name: Lifedrinker

entries: When a balor grabs a creature with a whip {@action Strike}, they can move the creature to any space in the whip's reach. The balor can move without ending the grab as long as the creature remains within the whip's reach, and the balor can move the creature to any other space in the whip's reach with an {@action Interact} action.
bot.name: Whip Reposition

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The banshee can hear heartbeats within 60 feet (imprecise).
top.name: Hears Heartbeats

entries: If in direct sunlight, the banshee is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use actions that have the {@trait attack} trait.
top.name: Sunlight Powerlessness

mid.trigger: A foe critically hits the banshee, or the banshee critically fails their save against a foe's damaging effect.
entries: The banshee lashes back at their tormentor, dealing {@damage 4d10+14} mental damage ({@dc 38} basic Will save) and applying the effects of terrifying touch based on the results of the same Will save.
mid.name: Vengeful Spite

entries: When a banshee {@action Stride||Strides} at least 10 feet, they're {@condition concealed} until the start of their next turn.
bot.name: Spectral Ripple

entries: A creature damaged by the banshee's touch that isn't already {@condition frightened} must attempt a {@dc 38} Will save ({@dc 43} if the attack was a critical hit). If the creature fails its save, it's {@condition frightened 2}; on a critical failure, the creature also cowers with fear and is {@condition stunned 4}. If the creature is protected against fear by a spell or magic item, the banshee's touch first attempts to counteract the protection effect, with the effect of a 9th-level {@spell dispel magic} spell.
bot.name: Terrifying Touch

entries: The banshee unleashes a soul-chilling {@spell wail of the banshee} ({@dc 38}). This Wail overcomes silence and similar effects of 5th level or lower. The banshee can instead use Wail as a three-action activity to overcome such effects of up to 8th level.

The banshee's Wail resonates for 1 round, and any creature that comes within the area during that time must attempt a save against the effect. A creature can't be affected more than once by the same Wail. The banshee can't Wail again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Wail

abilities: negative healing

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical
